topic.title: Example 2

bodydiv.p: In contrast, consider the same fact pattern except that the entity invests in the bonds to achieve the business model’s objective by both collecting contractual cash flows and selling bonds. Accordingly, upon transition to IFRS 9 the entity reclassifies Instrument A from available-for-sale to the fair value through other comprehensive income measurement category. This is because:

li.p: the financial assets are managed to achieve the business model’s objective by both collecting contractual cash flows and selling financial assets; and

the contractual cash flows are solely payments of principal and interest on the principal amount outstanding. The contractual cash flows reflect a return that is consistent with a basic lending arrangement.
